titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky vs. William J. Tice (alias Steele), Judgment
CWG9030

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: The following is a copy of the verdict of the Jury verdict rendered at the May Term 1863 of the Jefferson Circuit Court in the case of Commonwealth of Ky against Wm J Tice alias Steele. towit
"We of the Jury find the defendant guilty as charged in the within indictment and say that he shall be confined in the Penitentiary for one year, recommending him to the mercy of the Executive

Ben Cassseday, foreman"
A Copy
Attest Jas P Chambers C J C C

Hon Jas F. Robinson
Dear Sir

W J. Tice the person convicted as the above verdict sets forth, is a mere boy, his age does not exceed fifteen years, He is hansom & well disposed; every thing about him indicates that he has been well raised. We earnestly unite with the Jury & request your Excellency to grant him a pardon.
If your Excellency could see the boy after he arrives at Frankfort his extreme youth & gentle manners would induce a pardon.

If your Excellency should grant the pardon you will find the boy in
states prison as he will be carried there by the sheriff on Monday next

Very Respectfully
Baird & Price
Attorneys at Law
Baird & Price pettn for Pardon of W. J. Tice
Pardon granted having seen this boy find and with
He seemed to be very represented. He in two days after with my pardon now has move to Covington state two watches and is again arrested
